result.execSummary:
The defendant Shana L Wells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

1:27 PM Defendant Shana L Wells in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Shana L Wells.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Upon plea to Cts. 2 and 3 the State would recommend 6 mo. RCJ, i/s, probation and appropriate conditions.  Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters her plea.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  Defendant speaks on her own behalf.  
Plea:
Ct. 2- NC
Ct. 3- NC

BTC:
Ct. 1- DRI
Ct. 2- GUILTY, 6 mo. RCJ, i/s, 1 yr. probation. 
Ct. 3- GUILTY, 6 mo. RCJ, i/s, 1 yr. probation.  Concurrent to Ct. 2 if revoked. 

Conditions:
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent.  
Obtain and maintain full time employment.

records.addlTxt: atty Preston
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive unless properly licensed.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:40 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Shana L Wells appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Shana L Wells. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
